column4: Any one know a good app to diagnose/fix bad sectors on a hd outside of fsck which is not doing the trick?
if the disk is bad best to backup
thats not an indication the disk is still ood
Right, I'd like to be able to mount the partition, so I can back it up if possible,, then replace the hd
fsck has a badblocks option and autofix and such, you could try to et it to sort the issues with that
as a recovery method, using dd to dump it contents works in absense of a working filesystem
cooling the disks can also help with datarecovery
carefull that you select test only, bb also has an intensive surface test option that erases data

Lolgrr.. I even put the hd in the fridge for a few minutes as I've heard that, and have knocked it around a bit heh. I was able to get the pc to boot in to ubuntu once,, and it locked up and I haven't been ale to get in since
dont boot the disk, use a livecd, do a quick check and go straight to dumping your data
i mean with dumping the win partition since that works
try dumping the partition with dd
You wouldn't happen to have a link that explains it a bit in detail?
see the datarecovery link it details doing it with dd
